summary: I EXPERIENCED TWO SIDEWALL TIRE FAILURES ON MY TOW DOLLY WHICH HAD NANCO TIRES. ONE OF THE FAILURES RESULTED IN DAMAGE TO MY TOW DOLLY AND DESTRUCTION OF THE WHEEL THE TIRE WAS MOUNTED ON, AND A GRASS FIRE ON THE EXPRESSWAY. THESE FAILURES REQUIRED REPLACEMENT OF BOTH TIRES AND ONE WHEEL AFTER THE SECOND TIRE FAILED. I AM CONCERNED BECAUSE  WANTS THE TIRE BACK TO PROCESS THE CLAIM. *TR

2001 DODGE RAM EXTENDED CAB 1500 MAGNUM 5.9L ENGINE.    DASH SEVERELY CRACKED/FALLING APART.  THIN BRITTLE PLASTIC, NOT NORMAL WEAR AND TEAR.  IS COMMON TO 2ND GEN 01 RAMS.  NEWS STORY ON PROBLEM AT :  HTTP://WWW.LOCAL6.COM/MONEY/13227601/DETAIL.HTML  IS A SAFETY FACTOR.  *TR

THE MULTIFUNCTION SWITCH MUST BE PINCHED OR BAD IN MY MONTE, MY TURN SIGNALS ONLY WORK WHEN THEY WANT, MY WINDOWS, RADIO, AND FOUR WAYS ONLY WORK WHEN THEY WANT TOO. I HAVE OWNED A CHEVY SINCE I STARTED DRIVING 20 PLUS YEARS AGO AND I HAVE NEVER HAD ANYTHING LIKE THIS HAPPEN IT IS VERY DANGEROUS AND I CANNOT AFFORD TO BUY A NEW ONE, THEREFORE I HAVE DECIDED TO GO WITH ANOTHER MANUFACTURER FOR ANOTHER VEHICLE. I AM VERY DISAPPOINTED BECAUSE I HAVE ALWAYS LIKED CHEVYS, BUT I CAN`T TAKE THE SAFETY RISK.  *TR

I SUFFERED A FLAT TIRE AS A RESULT OF THE DEFECTIVE TIRE.  WHEN I TOOK IT TO BE REPAIRED, THE REPAIR PERSON SAID THAT I WAS LUCKY TO BE ALIVE BECAUSE I COULD HAVE HAD A BLOW OUT ON THE HIGHWAY.  THE OTHER TWO TIRES WERE ALSO COMING APART AT THE SIDEWALLS.  ALL OF THEM WERE SPLIT AND THE RUBBER WAS COMING OFF.  I AM THANKFUL THAT I DID NOT HAVE A BLOWOUT BECAUSE I HAVE A SMALL CHILD WHO COULD HAVE BEEN BADLY HURT.  I STILL HAVE THREE OF THESE TIRES.    *JB

DEER RAN OUT IN FRONT OF ME AND I APPLIED MY BRAKES.  BRAKES RELEASED ON MY VEHICLE CAUSING ME TO HIT THE DEER.  I HAD ASKED ABOUT THIS PROBLEM BEFORE TO THE MANUFACTURER WHEN I NOTICED IT DONE THIS.  THEY SAID THERE WAS NO RECALL AND THAT THERE WAS NO PROBLEM WITH THE BRAKES.  I TOOK THERE WORD ON THIS BECAUSE I HAD JUST GOT THE TRUCK A FEW MONTHS BEFORE THIS AND IT VERY SELDOM DONE IT SO I FIGURED IT WAS JUST LIKE ANTI RELEASE BRAKES TO AVOID SKIDDING OR SOMETHING.  THIS ACCIDENT WOULD HAVE BEEN AVOIDED IF THE BRAKES HAD NOT MALFUNCTIONED.  I HAVE FILED A CLAIM WITH MY INSURANCE COMPANY WHICH IS GEICO.  TO MY OPINION LOOKING BACK THERE WERE SEVERAL FAILURES BUT THIS IS THE BIGGEST.  IT WAS LIKE I HAD NO BRAKES AT ALL. *JB

DT*: THE CONTACT STATED THE VALVE STEMS ON ALL FIVE TIRES OF THE T.U.F. INDUSTRIES TRAILER WERE DISINTEGRATING SO BADLY, THAT THE CAPS PEELED OFF WHEN THE CONTACT ATTEMPTED TO CHECK THE AIR PRESSURE.  NEITHER THE TRAILER NOR THE TIRES WERE SEEN BY A DEALER.  UPDATED 10/31/2006 - ALL 5 VALVE STEMS WERE CRACKED 360 DEGREES AROUND THE STEM.  THE DEPTH OF THE CRACK WAS ALL THE WAY TO THE METAL CORE HOLDER.  THE SPARE TIRE HAD BEEN STORED IN A GARAGE OUT OF SUNLIGHT, YET IT WAS JUST AS BAD AS THE TIRES ON THE TRAILER.  SINCE THE TIRES WERE TUBELESS THE VALVE STEMS MAY OR MAY NOT HAVE BEEN OF GOODYEAR MANUFACTURER (GOODYEAR WORKHORSE 7.50X16LT TUBELESS).  *NM

I HAVE BEEN TOLD BY MY BMW CERTIFIED MECHANIC , THAT MY X5, 4.4 HAS MANY ELECTRICAL ISSUES , THE AIR CONDITIONER CUTS ON AND OFF AT HIGH SPEEDS AT ITS OWN WILL, I AM HAVING ISSUES WITH MY ELECTRICAL, HAZARD LIGHTS , THEY JUST QUIT WORKING , I HAVE PROBLEMS, WITH MY DISPLAY , AS WELL, AS THE OTHER GENTLEMAN, I HAVE PROBLEMS WITH MY INTER-LOCKING SYSTEM WORKING CORRECTLY ... I ALSO HAVE HAD TO REPLACE ALL OF THE BLINKERS, LIGHTS AND TURN SIGNALS. I HAVE COMPLAINED TO BMW OF NORTH AMERICA , ONLY TO FALL OF DEF EARS... I DO HOPE THAT SOMETHING COMES OF ALL OF THESE COMPLAINTS AND THAT BMW STEPS UP TO THE PLATE , I BOUGHT MY CAR WITH 53000 MILES ON IT .. AND HAVE HAD ISSUES FROM DAY ONE.. BMW STATES THAT BECAUSE ITS NOT BMW CERTIFIED AND THAT I BOUGHT IT FROM AN INDEPENDENT DEALERSHIP.. THAT THEY BASICALLY WASH THEIR HANDS OF IT ... I THINK IT SAD , TO PAY THIS MUCH MONEY FOR A CAR , THAT EVEN THE MANUFACTURE WILL NOT STAND BEHIND.. I DON'T CARE WHO SOLD ME THE CAR... IT WAS BOUGHT ON A CAR LOT... NOT A SECOND RATE PAWN SHOP.....  ITS A BMW , STAND BEHIND IT.  *JB

RETURNING HOME TO SLIDELL, LA FROM LITTLE ROCK ARKANSAS DUE TO HURRICANE KATRINA EVACUATION WHEN LEFT REAR TIRE ON A 2001 SPORT TRAIL TANDEM AXLE BOAT TRAILER FAILED.  SPEED 55 MPH, TIRE (CARLISLE USA TRAIL ST205/75D14, DOT UUKC ACC3001) HAD A BLOW OUT JUST BEFORE LOUISIANA STATE LINE.  BOAT TRAILER HAS A 2001 SEA OX 223F BOAT- DRY, NO RIGGING OR EXTRA WEIGHT.  BOAT AND TRAILER PURCHASED BRAND NEW IN FEBRUARY OF 2003.  ALL TIRES APPEAR IN GREAT SHAPE, REGULAR PRESSURE CHECKS.  BLOWN TIRE HAS 8MM (1/4") + OF TREAD DEPTH.  UPON SEARCHING FOR A SAME REPLACEMENT TO KEEP A MATCH AND GEARING FOR THIS HURRICANE SEASON, I WAS QUITE SURPRISED AT THE NUMBER OF CARLISLE TIRE FAILURES.   IT IS EVIDENT A TIME PERIOD CARLISLE PRODUCED FAULTY TIRES.  I AM NOT COMFORTABLE REPLACING THAT TIRE WITH THE SAME AND NOW PARANOID TO TOW THE TRAILER AGAIN HAVING THREE OTHER CARLISLE TIRES TO CONTEND WITH.  PLEASE REVIEW THE OCCURRENCES OF CARLISLE TIRE FAILURES, ENSURE THEY ARE CREDIBLE AND INITIATE A RECALL.  *NM

FROM: DAVE PIERSON  NOT EXACTLY A 'COMPLAINT', HOWEVER, SUGGEST IT IS  WORTHY OF THOUGHT.  COMMENTS:  OBSERVED ON MY SATURN SL 1.  NOT DISCUSSED WITH SATURN.  NOT KNOWN IF OCCURS IN OTHER VEHICLES,OR MODELS, OR MAKERS.  SPECIFCALLY:   'IGNITION SWITCH' (KEY) HAS:     LOCK      ACC       RUN        START   IN THAT ORDER.   IN ACC, KEY IS REMOVABLE, WITH EG RADIO REMAINING   POWERED. [1]   (SO FAR, FINE)   HOWEVER, IF THE TIP OF THE KEY, OR ANY OTHER   OBJECT OF SUITABLE SHAPE IS INSERTED IN THE   KEY OPENING, THE SWITCH CAN BE OPERATED FROM   ACC TO RUN OR START POSITION WITHOUT THE   KEY!   THIS SEEMS EXCEEDINGLY DANGEROUS AND INSECURE.   THAT IS: 'KIDS' LEFT IN CAR, WITH RADIO ON [2]   'PLAYING DRIVING', MANAGE TO GET IT STARTED AND...   LET ALONE THE ANTI THEFT ISSUES...  NOTES:  1) I WAS TOLD, YEARS AGO, THIS WAS TO ALLOW RADIO USE WITH   VEHICLE OTHERWISE SECURE.  2) GRANTED: THE KIDS SHOULDN'T BE LEFT, BUT...*JB

I PURCHASED A 2001 KIEFERBUILT EAGLE XLA. I USED THE TRAILER TWICE. THE SECOND TIME MY HORSE WAS LOADED IN THE REAR STALL. I WAS DRIVING 15 MPH THROUGH A SUBDIVISION WHEN THE REAR DOOR FAILED AND MY HORSE WAS EJECTED ONTO THE ROAD. HE SUFFERED SEVERE BURNS ON HIS KNEES, FETLOCKS AND STIFLES. HE WAS RAW TO THE CARPUS, AND THE REAR EXTENSOR TENDONS WERE DAMAGED. THE COMPANY CLAIMS NO RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE ACCIDENT, EVEN THOUGH THEIR CORPORATE REPRESENTATIVES WILL ADMIT THAT THE DOORS (I QUOTE) "WERE FLIMSY"--"WE WENT FROM HAVING THE WORST DOORS IN THE INDUSTRY TO THE BEST."AN INDEPENDENT ENGINEERING FIRM HAS DEEMED THESE DOORS UNSUITABLE FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE OF RESTRAINING A HORSE INSIDE THE TRAILER. *JB

WE PURCHASED A 2001 DODGE DURANGO WHEN I FINISHED THE NURSING PROGRAM AND STARTED WORKING.  WE REALLY WANTED A SAFER CAR FOR ME TO DRIVE MY 5 YEAR OLD AND 3 YEAR OLD LITTLE GIRLS.  I HAD A KIA SEPHIA BEFORE THIS PURCHASE.  WE THOUGHT WE HAD MADE A GREAT STEP UP, BUT I TELL YOU WHAT, WHAT JUST HAPPENED WITH THE DURANGO NEVER WOULD HAVE HAPPENED WITH THE KIA.       MY YOUNGEST DAUGHTER AND I WERE GOING TO SOME ERRANDS BEFORE WE HAD TO PICK MY OLDER DAUGHTER UP FROM KINDERGARTEN.  WHEN MY DAUGHTER CAME OUT OF THE HOUSE, OUR PUPPY SLIPPED OUT THE DOOR. I WAS ALREADY IN THE CAR WARMING IT UP AND WAITING FOR MY DAUGHTER TO COME OUT.  WHEN I NOTICED THE DOG SLIPPED OUT I PUT THE CAR IN PARK WHILE IT WAS STILL RUNNING SO I COULD CATCH THE PUPPY.  WELL, SHE TOOK OFF UP THE ROAD, SO I DECIDED I WOULD NOT LEAVE MY CAR RUNNING AS I ATTEMPTED TO CHASE DOWN THE PUPPY.  SO, I OPENED THE PASSENGER SIDE DOOR REACHED IN AND TURNED THE KEY TO SHUT IT OFF AND PULLED THE KEY OUT AND VEHICLE STARTED ROLLING.  OUR DRIVEWAY HAS THE SLIGHTEST SLOPE TO IT, BUT ENOUGH FOR THE RIG TO GET ROLLING.  IT TOOK OUT MY GARAGE DOOR.  I JUST THANK GOD THAT MY DAUGHTER WAS STANDING BEHIND THE VEHICLE AND NOT IN FRONT OR SHE WOULD HAVE BEEN RAN OVER.  THIS SHOULD NOT HAVE HAPPENED.  AS YOU KNOW IN MOST VEHICLE YOU CAN NOT TAKE THE KEYS OUT IF THE VEHICLE ISN'T IN PARK.  THE PART IS THAT IT DIDN'T ROLE WHEN IT WAS RUNNING AND IN PARK, BUT IT ROLLED WHEN IT WAS SHUT OFF.  THE GAUGE READ THAT IT WAS IN PARK.  I HAVE HAD THIS HAPPEN NUMEROUS TIMES BETWEEN NEUTRAL AND DRIVE.  THE GAUGE SAYS IT IS IN DRIVE AND WHEN YOU STEP ON THE GAS IT DOESN'T MOVE, IT JUST OVERWORKS THE MOTOR.   I TOOK IT IN THE DODGE DEALER AND HE ACTED LIKE HE'S NEVER HEARD OF SUCH A THING, BUT IF YOU GET ON LINE YOU CAN SEE IT HAS HAPPENED TO OTHERS. THEY SAID I WILL HAVE TO BRING IT BACK IN AND THEY WILL HAVE TRY TO GET THE VEHICLE TO MIMIC WHAT HAPPENED AND IF THEY CANT GET IT TO DO IT, THERE IS NOTHING THEY CAN DO.  *JB

DT. CONTACT S BOUGHT A MOTORCYCLE IN 2001 BRAND NEW FROM A DEALERSHIP. SINCE THE PURCHASE  THE VEHICLE HAD AN ENGINE  PROBLEM.  THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE  TO THE DEALER SEVERAL TIMES, AND  THEY CHANGED  THE SPARK PLUG. SOME TIMES THEY KEPT THE VEHICLE FOR A MONTH. THE CONTACT WANTED  TO EXCHANGE  THE VEHICLE  FOR ANOTHER  ONE BUT THE DEALER REFUSED TO DO IT.  THEN, HE DECIDED TO PRESENT  THE ENGINE PROBLEM  TO CONSUMER'S  PROTECTION OFFICE, WHERE HE GOT NO HELP.  THE CONTACT  TOOK  THE VEHICLE  TO OTHER MECHANICS, AND THEY COULD NOT FIND THE CAUSE OF THE  DEFECT. ACTUALLY,  THE MOTORCYCLE IS NOT DRIVABLE.  *AK

EMAIL FROM (WI) REQUEST ASSISTANCE IN GETTING GM TO INCLUDE THE STATE OF WISCONSIN IN ITS RECENT TRUCK/SUV ANTI-LOCK BRAKING SYSTEM RECALL, ALSO REQUEST REIMBURSEMENT FOR REPAIRS.  *TS  THE GM DEALER PERFORMED THE NECESSARY REPAIRS ON THE CONSUMERS VEHICLE AND TOLD THEM THEY WOULD BE REIMBURSED AFTER THE RECALL WENT INTO EFFECT, HOWEVER THE MANUFACTURER STATED THAT PARTICULAR STATE WAS EXCLUDED BECAUSE THEY HAD NOT RECEIVED SUFFICIENT COMPLAINTS
BROKEN MAIN FRAME.  IF NOT CORRECTED, COULD CAUSE SERIOUS DAMAGE TO OTHER VEHICLES OR PERSONS.  *NM

DT:  2001 W9 KENWORTH, KELLY TIRES 11R22.5.  THE CONSUMER STATED THE TREAD SEPARATED FROM THE TIRE.  THIS OCCURRED ON A TWO WEEK OLD TIRE LOCATED ON THE PASSENGER'S SIDE REAR INSIDE.  THE TIRE WAS TAKEN TO A  TRAVEL CENTER THEY SENT THE TIRE TO GOODYEAR.  GOODYEAR STATED IT WAS A DEFECTIVE TIRE.  THIS HAPPENED ON JULY 12, 2005.  THE CONSUMER STATED  THE MUD FLAP AND BAR   WAS RIPPED OFF WHEN THIS HAPPENED.*AK

MY PONTIAC GRAND AM 2001 CONTINUES TO HAVE PROBLEMS TICK NOISE AND WITH THE TURN SIGNALS ON THE VEHICLE.  I DON'T KNOW HALF THE TIME WHETHER THEY ARE WORKING OR NOT BECAUSE THE TICKING NOISE IS ALWAYS ON SO I DON'T KNOW IF THE TURN SIGNALS WORK OR NOT ON MOST OCCASIONS.  *NM

I WAS GETTING THE BUS . THE BUS DRIVER STOP BUT HE DID NOT PUT THE EMERGENCY BRAKE. BECAUSE HE WAS BUSY TALKING WITH PASSENGER. HE JERKED THE BUS. BECAUSE HE HIT THE BRAKES REAL QUICK IN WHICH I SLIPPED AND MY ARM GOT CAUGHT IN THE BACK OF THE RAIL WHERE THE HANDICAPPED USED TO GET ON AND OFF THE BUS THROUGH THE BACK DOOR. NOW THEY TELL ME THEY ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE. IT IS MESSING UP MY CREDIT.   *NM

WITHOUT ANY WARNING OUR ENGINE SEIZED ON OUR 2001 DODGE INTREPID.  BECAUSE THIS WAS SO SUDDEN AND UNEXPECTED MY HUSBAND HAD A DIFFICULT TIME CONTROLLING THE VEHICLE.  HE WAS ABLE TO AVOID AN ACCIDENT BUT WAS NARROWLY MISSED BY A LARGE MOVING TRUCK.
BIG WATER LEAK INTO PASSENGER COMPARTMENT JEEP WRANGLER 2001 AFTER AND DURING  RAINING.  IT HAS SHORT-CIRCUIT THE A/C.   LEAK COMING FROM A/C HOUSING.

I HAVE A 2001 EXTREME DUAL AXLE  BOAT TRAILER WITH CARLISLE 205 75 R14 TIRES UNK DOT #. WHILE DRIVING APPROX 60 MPH I HAD 2 REAR TIRE TREAD COMPLETELY SEPERATE FROM THE TIRE WHILE HEADING TO MY DESTINATION. ENROUTE BACK I WAS ADVISED BY A VEHICLE BEHIND ME THAT THERE WAS CHUNKS OF TREAD COMING OFF THE TRAILER TIRE. AFTER PULLING OVER TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD I NOTICED THAT THE LEFT FRONT TIRE TREAD WAS ALSO PEELING OFF. I CONTACT CARLISLE TIRE AND WAS ADVISED THAT THE TIRE WAS MADE BY GOODYEAR, BUT THEY NO LONGER USE THEM. THEY REIMBURSED ME FOR THE COST OF THE  3 TIRES EVEN THOUGH THEY WERE OUT OF WARRANTY (2 YEARS). I STILL HAVE 2 OF THE ORINGINAL TIRES, 1 ON THE TRAILER 1 AS A SPARE. I CONTACTED CARLISLE TO SEE IF THEY WOULD REPLACE THE 2 TIRES, BUT WAS TOLD THEY WERE OUT OF WARRANTY. THESE TIRES ALL HAVE LESS THEN 3000 MILES AND HAVE ALWAYS BEEN COVERED, OUT OF THE SUN AND PROPERLY INFLATED. I HAVE A BIG ISSUE WITH THESE TIRES DUE TOHAVING TO WORRY TOWING MY BOAT WITH MY CHILDREN IN THE CAR AS WELL AS SPENDING OVER 3 HOURS WAITING FOR  TOW TO ARRIVE IN THE DESERT LIKE LAST YEAR. APPRECIATE A RESPONSE RF

COOPER LL TOURING SLE SIZE 215/64TR16 - (1) TIRE HAD TREAD SEPARATION AFTER 6 MONTHS WITH 16,406 MILES ON IT; (1) TIRE HAD TREAD SEPARATION AFTER 20,725 MILES ON IT AND (1) TIRE HAD TREAD SEPARATION AFTER 37,131 MILES ON IT.  THE 2ND TIRE MENTIONED REPLACED THE FIRST TIRE MENTIONED ON 10/05/04.  THEN THE 2ND AND 3RD TIRE MENTIONED HAD TREAD SEPARATION AT THE SAME TIME ON 04/29/05.  *AK

VEHICLE: 2001 AUDI 1.8 LITER TT QUATTRO ROADSTER:  EVENT: LOSS OF CONTROL AND  FAILED POWER STEERING PUMP.   DURING A SLOW SPEED EXIT FROM A PUBLIC PARKING LOT CAR BECAME UNCONTROLLABLE AS I ENTERED A PUBLIC ROAD. THE VEHICLE PROCEEDED STRAIGHT AS I WAS UNABLE TO TURN THE STEERING WHEEL . THE CAR CROSSED THE CENTER LINE OF A PUBLIC STREET AND ALMOST HIT AN ONCOMING VEHICLE HEAD ON.  THE OTHER DRIVER WAS ABLE TO SWERVE AND EVADE MY UNCONTROLLABLE VEHICLE OR ELSE THERE WOULD HAVE BEEN A HEAD-ON COLLISION.  FAILURE: POWER STEERING PUMP, AND THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT TURN LEFT NOR RIGHT AT LOW SPEEDS.  CORRECTION:  THE CAR WAS DELIVERED TO THE LOCAL AUDI DEALERSHIP LUJACK'S, DAVENPORT, IOWA WHO INVESTIGATED AND DETERMINED THAT THE POWER STEERING PUMP HAD TOTALLY FAILED DURING ROUTINE USAGE.  THE CAR WAS NO LONGER UNDER WARRANTY, AND REPEATED TELEPHONIC COMMUNICATIONS BETWEEN AUDI OF NORTH AMERICA, LUJACK'S AND MYSELF YIELDED NO RELIEF, NO COMPENSATION, AND NO SATISFACTION.  THIS COULD HAVE BEEN A LIFE OR DEATH SITUATION, AND IN OTHER CIRCUMSTANCES, MAY WELL HAVE LEAD TO THE DEATHS OF SEVERAL INNOCENT PERSONS. THE CAR WAS TOTALLY OUT OF CONTROL.  *AK

NUMEROUS ELECTRICAL PROBLEMS AND SYMPTOMS WHICH INCLUDES VARIOUS PANEL WARNING LIGHTS COMING ON MY DASH, RADIO SYSTEM BLACKOUTS, CAR STALLING ON TURNS AND SHUT DOWN ON THE INTERSTATE 495 (WASHINGTON DC AREA), REAR BRAKE LIGHTS BULB BURNOUTS, AND HEADLAMP BULB REPLACEMENTS TOTALING 10 BULB REPLACEMENTS.  THE WORST IS NOW WHEN THEY RECOMMENDED A NEW TRANSMISSION WHICH I AM ASSUMING IS NOT MECHANICAL BUT SOME SORT OF ELECTRIC PROBLEM WITH THEIR COMPUTERIZED TRANSMISSION.  ON TOP OF THAT, THE SERVICE STATION THAT DIAGNOSED IT HAD WRITTEN A REPORT THAT BMW NA SUGGESTED TO REPLACE THE ENTIRE TRANSMISSION BEING THAT MY 2001 325I IS ONLY 68,600 MILES.  MAJORITY OF COMPLAINT CENTERED AROUND BMW NA SINCE I COMPLAINED ABOUT THE MANUFACTURING AND  BMW SERVICE FOR THEIR INEPT DIAGNOSIS SKILLS.  I BROUGHT MY VEHICLE TO VOB BMW ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS MENTIONING  THAT I THOUGHT THERE MIGHT BE SOME TYPE OF ELECTRICAL PROBLEM--ALTHOUGH THEIR DIAGNOSIS ALWAYS SHOW UP DIFFERENT.    HAVING A CAR STALL IN THE MIDDLE OF RUSH HOUR IS NOT JUST EMBARRASSING BUT DANGEROUS SINCE I'VE HAD CARS HAD TO AVOID OR SLAM ON THEIR BRAKES TO AVOID MY VEHICLE.   MY ANGER IS NOT ABOUT THE LITTLE THINGS THAT CAN GO WRONG BUT WHILE THE CAR IS MOVING AND THEN SOMETHING HAPPENS TO IT IN A FLOW OF TRAFFIC AT CONSIDERABLE SPEED IS DANGEROUS!  MY CAR STALLED 5 DIFFERENT OCCASIONS AND THREE OF THEM ON THE BELTWAY (I-495 WASHINGTON DC METRO AREA) DURING RUSH HOUR SINCE EARLY 2003.  I AVOIDED TWO CAR ACCIDENTS AND HAD ONE VERY MINOR FENDER BENDER WHEN MY CAR STALLED AND ANOTHER VEHICLE MADE CONTACT WITH MY REAR BUMPER ON I-495.*AK

MY 2001 SUZUKI ENGINE IS MAKING NOISES THAT SEEMS TO COME FROM THE INSIDE OF THE ENGINE. MECHANIC STATED THAT WAS EITHER THE CAM SHAFT OR THE TIMING CHAIN. IN 2003 I TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER FOR A RECALL (NOT RELATED TO THE NOISE) AND WHEN I TOLD THEM ABOUT IT, THEY SAID IT WAS NORMAL. NOW I FOUND OUT THAT THERE ARE A LOT OF PROBLEMS WITH THE ENGINES OF MY CAR.I WANT MY CAR REPAIR.*AK

I STRUCK A SMALL POT HOLE AND THE REAR DRIVERS LEAF SPRING BROKE.  THIS CAUSED THE SUSPENSION TO SAG AND THE AXLE TO SIFT TO THE REAR.  THE TIRE RUBBED ON THE FENDER RESULTING IN BURNED PAINT.  THE TIRE DEFLATED BEFORE A FIRE COULD OCCUR.  IF THE TIRE HADN'T BEEN CUT DOWN, A FIRE CERTAINLY WOULD HAVE OCCURED.  THE SPRING BROKE THROUGH THE LOCATING BOLT HOLE.  BY ALL APPEARANCES THE HARDWARE WAS STILL TIGHT.*AK

I PURCHASED A ROADMASTER TRAILER IN 2001.  THE AXLE WAS NOT MOUNTED PROPERLY ACCORDING TO THE 3500 LB. RATING AND WIDTH OF TRAILER. I HAVE TECHNICAL DOCUMENTATION OF THIS FAULT. CAUSING AXLE TO BEND AT HUB FACE.   *LA

PROBLEMS WITH STEERING WHEEL AND CARBURETOR.   *MR   THE CONSUMER REMOVED THE SIDE CAR.  AT 60 MPH THE HANDLE  BAR STARTED TO VIBRATE SO RAPIDLY THE CONSUMER WAS THROWN OFF THE BIKE.  ON ANOTHER OCCASION, THE CONSUMER STARTED THE MOTORCYCLE AND HEARD AN EXPLOSION IN THE RIGHT CARBURETOR WITHIN MINUTES, THE MOTORCYCLE WAS ENGULFED IN FLAMES.  (URAL BC65 2001)   *SCC   *JB
TRICKE TRAILER.  NO DEFECTS LISTED.  *AK
REDNECK ENGINEERING GAS TANK FAILURE.  *NLM
REDNECK ENGINEERING FRAME BROKE AT NECK WHILE RIDING MOTORCYCLE.  SERIAL NUMBER IS RER250B0510012223.   *NLM

THE AMERICAN WIRE WHEEL ON THE REAR OF MY MOTORCYCLE BASICALLY FELL APART WHILE I WAS RIDING IT.  IT IS A RADIAL SPOKED WHEEL AND THERE WAS NOT ONE SPOKE CONNECTED BETWEEN THE HUB AND THE RIM.  THEY ALL CAME OUT WHILE I WAS RIDING.  I THOUGHT I WAS EXPERIENCING A FLAT TIRE AS THE REAR OF THE BIKE BEGAN TO WOBBLE, I STARTED TO SLOW DOWN AND THE REAR OF THE MOTORCYCLE JUST DROPPED DOWN ON THE PAVEMENT DUE TO ALL THE SPOKES COMING OUT OF THE HUB AND RIM.  I DO HAVE PICTURES OF THE WHEEL THAT FELL APART.   *JB
CONSUMER IS EXPERIENCING PROBLEMS WITH TIRES,  FIRESTONE POTENZA SIZE #P215/45R17.  THE TIRES HAVE BLISTERS.  MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN CONTACTED.  MR
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK

TWO RELATIVE NEW CARLISLE ST TIRES FAILED BACK TO BACK.  THE FIRST ONE, AT A SPEED OF 60 MPH, TEMPERATURE NEAR 92, TRAILER VERY LIGHTLY LOADED, NO WATER IN ANY TANKS. THE TIRE TOTALLY DISINTEGRATED BEFORE A REASONABLE STOPPING DISTANCE WAS REACHED. I WAS SOME WHAT LUCKIER ON THE SECOND TIRE. I STARTED FEELING VIBRATIONS AND STOPPED. THE BELT WAS SEPARATING AND PROTRUDING THROUTH THE TREAD, HOWEVER, THE TIRE STILL HELD AIR.*AK

TIRE TREAD SPLIT 15 IN. STAYED IN CAMPGROUND 10 DAYS.  COMING OUT OF CAMP GROUND  AT A STOP SIGN A DRIVER PULLED ALONG SIDE & SAID SOMETHING WAS WRONG WITH MY LEFT REAR TIRE ON TRAILER. FOUND SAFE SPOT TO PULL OVER, CHECKED TIRE & FOUND IT SPLIT. THERE IS STILL LOTS OF WEAR ON THE TIRE.  IT LOOKS LIKE A MANUFACTURE DEFECT. ALL MY TIRES ARE KEEP AT RECOMMENDED PRESSURE WITH A TIRE GAUGE CHECKED FOR ACCURACY.*AK

THE BLUE HEADLIGHTS ARE VERY DANGEROUS AND SHOULD BE ILLEGAL. THEY ARE ESPECIALLY DANGEROUS OIN MOUNTAIN DRIVING. ONCOMING CARS WITH THESE LIGHTS BLIND THE DRIVER IN AN ALREADY DANGEROUS CONDITIONS. PLEASE STOP THE MANFACTURES FROM INSTALLING THESE ON NEW CARS AND HAVE ALL CARS WITH THEM RECALLED.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING @ HIGHWAY SPEED, FELT SLIGHT VIBRATION ON RIGHT TRAVEL TRAILER TIRE. INSPECTION DISCOVERED CHUNKS OF TREAD MISSING ON INSIDE OF TIRE, EXPOSING TWO BELTS OF INNER COMPONENT AND CORD.  TIRE WAS CHECKED FOR PROPER INFLATION-OK. REPLACED W/SPARE. *AK (DOT NUMBER: UNKNOWN  TIRESIZE: 205/75R14)

THIS COMPLAINT IS CONCERNING HID HEADLAMPS ON NEWER MODEL VEHICLES.  THEY ARE VERY BLINDING AND EYES TAKE CONSIDERABLY MORE TIME TO RECOVER AFTER PASSING A VEHICLE EQUIPED WITH HID.  CONSIDER BANNING THESE PLEASE.*AK

HALOGEN HEADLIGHTS BLIND THE ON COMING CAR ESPECIALLY ON RURAL ROADS.  I HAVE HAD SEVERAL NEAR COLLISIONS AND NEARLY RAN OFF THE ROAD BECAUSE OF THESE OVERLY BRIGHT HEADLIGHTS. EVEN ON DIM LET ALONE BRIGHT.  THEY NEED TO BE OUTLAWED.  *AK

THE MOTORCYCLE CANNOT BE SAFELY RIDDEN. UPON THROTTLE DOWN, THE MOTORCYCLE ATTEMPTS TO THROW THE RIDER FORWARD OVER THE HANDLEBARS. THE DEALER HAS RIDDEN THE MACHINE AND HAS ACKNOWLEDGED THE PROBLEM. THE MANUFACTURERS REPRESENTATIVE (MOTO-GUZZI NORTH AMER. *AK

FUEL INJECTION FLAWED.  MOTORCYCLE WILL SURGE FORWARD WHEN APPROACHING A STOP FOR NO APPERANT REASON.  ALSO THE THROTTLE TRAVEL IS VERY SHORT MAKING ACCELERATION CONTROL VERY DIFICULT.   THE LOCAL CANNONDALE DEALER SAYS THIS IS COMMON ON 2001S AND CANNONDALE HAS DEVELOPED A NEW FUEL INJECTION WHICH CURES THIS FOR THE 2002 MODELS.  STANDARD POLICY OF DIRT BIKE DEALERS IS TO NOT ALLOW TEST RIDES AS THIS CREATES A USED BIKE FOR THEM.  HOW IS ONE TO KNOW OF THESE PROBLEMS UP FRONT?

MY COMPLAINT IS NOT RELATED TO A SPECIFC AUTOMOBILE.  IT IS A COMPLAINT RELATED TO THE BLUE TINTED HEADLIGHTS THAT ARE HIGH INTENSITY.  THESE LAMPS POSE A SAFETY HAZARD FOR THEY CAUSE THE DRIVER FACING SUCH AN AUTOMOBILE TO BE DISTRACTED.*AK
WELDS BROKE ON PROPANE. TANK WAS DRAGGED ON PAVEMENT 1/8 MILE. COULD HAVE CAUSED A FIRE AND EXPLOSION AS PROPANE IS VERY  EXPLOSIVE. *AK

THE PLASTIC UNDER CARRAGE CRACKED AND BROKE TO WHERE IS DRAGGED ON THE HIGHWAY.  PULLED OFF, MADE TEMPORARY REPAIRS AND WHEN ON. *AK
CAR HAS MAJOR PROBLEM STARTING COLD OR HOT. *AK

PROBLEM WAS REPORTED TO DEALER AFTER FIRST ROAD TRIP.  MOTORHOME IS DIFFICULT TO STEER/CONTROL AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS.  SERVICE MANAGER AT DEALER DESCRIBED IT AS SCARY AFTER TEST DRIVING IT.  DEALER HAS ATTEMPTED TO REPAIR PROBLEM - ALIGNMENT, WHEEL BALANCING, STEERING ADJUSTMENT.  SOME IMPROVEMENT NOTED, BUT VEHICLE IS STILL UNSAFE AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS.
I THINK THE NEW BRIGHT WHITE LIGHTS ARE HAZARDOUS TO DRIVERS OF ONCOMING VEHICLES.  IS THERE ANY REGULATION PERTAINING TO THEM?

REAR BACK WINDOW HAS BEEN LEAKING, IM SURE SINCE BEFORE WE PURCHASED THE VEHICLE. WEATHERSTRIP HAS BEEN REPLACED TWICE, WINDOW HAS BEEN REMOVED AND REPOSITIONED TWICE, AND THIS LAST TIME IN SHOP WAS KIA MOTORS FINAL ATTEMPT. REPAIR SHOP USED AN "AFTER MARKET" WINDOW SEALANT TO TRY TO COVER UP LEAKS. AFTERMARKET SEALANT IS ALL ON TOP OF INSIDE OF THE WINDOW AND IS EVEN ON THE HEALINER. BACK DECK, REAR SEATS, AND 1/4 OF HEADLINER HAS BEEN SOAKED DUE TO WATER LEAK. UNFORTUNATELY WATER IS LEAKING INTO SPARE TIRE COMPARTMNET NOW. DEALER/REPAIR SHOP DOESN'T KNOW WHAT ELSE TO DO WITH THIS REAR WINDOW. ALSO MY DRIVERS BACK PASSENGER WINDOW LEAKS. IT HAS ALSO BEEN IN SHOP 5 TIMES TO BE FIXED. THIS LAST TIME THEY REPLACED DOOR PANEL AND REALIGNED DRIVERS DOOR AND BACK DRIVERS PASSENGER DOOR. WE WERE TOLD THAT THIS WINDOW WILL STILL LEAK DURING A MANUAL CAR WASH. WE ARE NOW LOOKING TO KIA MOTORS OF AMERICA TO REPLACE THE VEHICLE. THE WINDOWS THAT I MENTIONED, THE REAR BACK WINDOW IS NOT TO FACTORY SPECIFICATIONS. WE FEEL THAT IF IT DIDNT COME OFF THE ASSEMBLY LINE WITH BLACK GOOP IN THE INSIDE OF THE WINDOW THEN IT SHOULDN'T BE RETURNED TO US THAT WAY EITHER. WE FEEL KIA AND THE DEALER ARE JUST TRYING TO COVER UP THE PROBLEM INSTEAD OF FINDNG OUT WHY AND HOW IT LEAKS. WE HAVE SUGGESTED THAT MAYBE THERE IS A DEFECT IN THE METAL MOLD OF THE VEHICLE, INSTEAD OF THE WINDOW ITSELF.*AK
THE NEW HEADLIGHTS ON ALL MERCEDES, BMW, AND OTHERS ARE TERRIBLY ANNOYING  FOR ONCOMING DRIVERS.  THESE EXTRA BRIGHT HEADLIGHTS SHOULD BE RECALLED AND ELIMINATED.*AK
REAR SPRING FAILURE CAUSED TOWED VEHICLE TO RUN OFF THE ROAD AND BE TOTALED, AS WELL AS THE TRAILER. *AK

APRIL 30 2001 WHILE PROCEEDED HOME AFTER PICKING UP MY NEW TRAVELTRAILER I STOPPED FOR GAS IN ITHACA MI. AS I WAS FILLING UP I NOTICED TRAILER PLUG WAS OUT OF MY ELECTRICAL PLUG IN ON MY TRUCK. MIRACULOUSLY  I FOUND A NAPA  REPAIR SHOP ABLE TO REPAIR MY TRAILER PLUG. AS I WAS ENTERING THE FREEWAY AGAIN I NOTICED  HEADLIGHTS OUT ON THE TRAILER AGAIN. *AK I WAS ABLE TO GET BACK TO THE REPAIR SHOP AND BETWEEN THE MECHANIC AND I WE DETERMINED THAT THE ELECTICAL CORD COMING FROM THE TRAILER WAS NOT LONG ENOUGH TO ACCOMODATE TURNS ON THE VEHICLE AND THE PLUG WOULD COME OUT OF THE ELECTICAL CONNECTION.  WE THEN PUT ON A SHORTER RECIEVER ON THE HIT CH AND IT SOLVED THE PROBLEM. ON MAY 2, 2001, I  CONTACTED ALINER  IN MAMMOTH PA. (724) 423-7440  AND  THE GENERAL MANAGER RETURNED MY CALL, THEY AGREED TO MAKE AN ADJUSTMENT TO MY LOSS BUT DIDNT SEEM TOO  CONCERNED ABOUT THE SAFETY PROBLEM I ADRESSED.

THE PROBLEM IS RELATED TO MALFUNCTION OF THE REARVIEW MIRRORS SUPPLIED WITH THE VEHICLE SINCE DATE OF PURCHASE.  THESE REARVIEW MIRRORS DO NOT MONITOR THE REAL DISTANCE OF THE APPROACHING VEHICLES FROM THE BACK, GIVING THE WRONG IMPRESSION TO THE DRIVER THAT THOSE VEHICLES ARE FARTHER BACK THAN THEY REALLY ARE.  WHILE ON THE MANEUVER OF CHANGING LANES BASED ON THE WRONG INFORMATION THESE MIRRORS MONITOR TO ME, I HAVE BEEN ON THE VERGE OF SEVERAL SERIOUS ACCIDENTS.  THE RIGHT REARVIEW MIRROR WAS CHANGED DURING A RECALL CAMPAING LAST YEAR, BUT THE IMPROVEMENT TO THE SITUATION ALREADY DESCRIBED IS REALLY MINIMAL.  THIS SITUATION WAS ALREADY INFORMED TO THE NHTSA SINCE SEPT/2000 AND THE REFERENCE NUMBER 554764 WAS ASSSIGNED TO IT.  MY QUERRY WAS REFERRED TO THE OFFICE OF SAFETY PERFORMANCE STANDARDS (NPS-01),  AS PER A LETTER DATED MAR/20/2001, SIGNED BY ALBERTO A. JIMINEZ.

WHILE GOING DOWN THE ROAD AT 60MPH THE PARKING BRAKE CAME ON LOCKING THE REAR WHEELS AND BRING THE MOTORHOME TO SKIDDING STOP. THE PARKING BRAKE IS ELECTRICALLY CONTROLED AND THE REPAIR FACILITY SAID THERE WAS A BAD CONNECTOR. WHEN THE PARKING BRAKE COMES ON BY ITS SELF WHILE DRIVING DOWN THE ROAD AT 60 MPH IT CREATS A VERY HAZARDOUS SITUATION. WE WERE TRAVELING ON A RUAL ROAD IF WE HAD BEEN ON AN INTERSTATE IT WOULD PROBABELY RESULTED IN AN ACCIDENT. THE MOTOR HOME IS ON A 2001 WORKHORSE CHASSIE.*AK

I PERSONALLY KNOW 5 MEN THAT HAVE BOUGHT THIS MACHINE AND 4 OF THEM HAVE THIS PROBLEM. WHILE SITTING AT AN IDLE THE MACHINE WILL NOT DISENGAGE THE AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION CAUSING THE MACHINE TO ROLL AWAY. IT IS DEFENITELY MUCH WORSE IN REVERSE. THE MACHINE WILL ROLL UP TO 5 - 10 MILES PER HOUR. THE IDLE HAS BEEN ADJUSTED DOWN AS LOW AS POSSIBLE WITHOUT THE MACHINE STALING. TWO OF THESE HAVE BEEN TAKEN BACK TO THE DEALER AND THEY REPLACED THE CLUTCH ASSEMBLY BUT SOME OF THE MACHINES ARE OUT OF WARRANTY AND IT IS QUITE COSTLY TO HAVE THIS DONE. POLARIS SHOULD BE CONCERNED WITH SAFETY ENOUGH TO ASK EVERYONE WITH A PROBLEM TO BRING THESE MACHINES BACK SO THAT THEY CAN FIX THIS BEFORE IT RUNS SOMEONE OVER OR EVEN ROLLS DOWN A HILL WITH NO DRIVER AND HURTING SOMEONE THAT MIGHT JUST BE STANDING THERE.*AK

ON DELIVERY OF TRUCK (ODOMETER READ 9 MILES) THERE WAS BRAKE NOISE(GRINDING) WHEN THE BRAKES WERE APPLIED.  AFTER APPROXIMATELY 1000 MILES I HAD THE DEALER CHECK THE NOISE.  THEY THOUGHT IT WAS A WARPED BRAKE ROTOR AND REPLACED THE ROTOR.  THIS DIDN'T CORRECT THE PROBLEM SO THEY NEXT REPLACED THE REAR WHEEL BEARINGS.  THIS DID NOT FIX THE PROBLEM.  NOW THEY ARE TAKING THE REAR AXLE APART AND MEASURING THE HOUSING AND AXLE. *AK
